questions.question_text:
The Team Manager has received notification that the new hardware and software solution has been installed and completed, but there is a concern that it has not been approved by the appropriate people.
Which 2 actions should the Team Manager take to check that the completed products have been approved as required?

choices.E: Check the Product Descriptions for the quality method required.
choices.A: Check the Work Package to ascertain who should approve the completed Work Package.
choices.D: Check the approval records as required in the Work Package.
choices.B: Check the Product Descriptions to ascertain who should have approved the products.
choices.C: Check the Configuration Management Strategy for product handover procedures.

discussion.content:
B & D
18.3 obtaining approval for completed products from the authorities identified in the product description.
18.4.2 check the work package and follow the method of obtaining and issuing approval records

Based on the search results, the two actions that the Team Manager should take to check that the completed products have been approved as required are:

B. Check the Product Descriptions to ascertain who should have approved the products.
The Team Manager should review the Product Descriptions to determine who should have approved the completed products. The Product Descriptions outline the quality criteria and acceptance criteria for each product, as well as the roles and responsibilities of the approvers. By checking the Product Descriptions, the Team Manager can ensure that the appropriate people have reviewed and approved the products.

D. Check the approval records as required in the Work Package.
The Team Manager should review the approval records as specified in the Work Package. The Work Package should include information on the approval process for the completed products, including the names of the individuals or roles responsible for approving the products. By checking the approval records, the Team Manager can verify that the products have been approved as required.

This question seems to refer to the old syllabus, as per 6th ed. syllabus it should be A and E options. A options because in the WP we have the Approval Method paragraph that tells who will approve the WP's products and E options because the quality methods are in the PDs (attachment of the WP).

Selected Answer: CD
D) Option D should be clear. 
When it comes to option C or E, I think both could be relevant, but sequentially I would choose C before E. Also, I'm not sure about the comment below "TM gets all details from WORK package and is not supposed to check any other management documents." From my understanding, the Communication Management Strategy is a part of the PID, and in general all stakeholders in the project should be able to see and understand the overall criterias in the project which are documented in the PID if they desire so.

Selected Answer: DE
Agree with the answer D & E. 
A can NOT be correct as creating exception report is not duty of Team Manager.
B also NOT as the TM should not wait that long to highlight a risk.
C also NOT as TM gets all details from WORK package and is not supposed to check any other management documents. 

So checking work package for development interface and raising an issue to notify the Project Manager are correct options.

C and D

It is important to note that options A, B, and E are not the most appropriate initial actions in this situation. Notifying the Project Manager by raising an Exception Report may be premature without first gathering more information and understanding the situation. Raising the concern in the next Checkpoint Report may not provide immediate attention to the issue. Raising an issue to notify the Project Manager of the concern may be appropriate, but it should be done after conducting the necessary checks and gathering relevant information.

questions.question_text:
The Work Package has been in progress for four weeks and has four weeks remaining. The Information Technology Team Manager is concerned that he has no idea what the service provider is doing about preparing to accept the transfer of Information Technology equipment and staff. He is uncertain about what should be happening.
Which 2 initial actions should the Team Manager take in response to this concern?

choices.D: Check the Information Technology Work Package for development interfaces to see whether the service provider Team Manager should have been liaising with the Information Technology team during development.
choices.B: Raise this concern in the next fortnightly Checkpoint Report.
choices.C: Check the Communication Management Strategy to ascertain what records of communications with the service provider are required.
choices.A: Notify the Project Manager by raising an Exception Report.
choices.E: Raise an issue to notify the Project Manager of this concern.

discussion.content: section 3.7

choices.A: Ensure project controls are based on project's scale, complexity, importance, capability and risk
choices.C: To tailor the use of the principles to suit the project
choices.D: To pick which PRINCE2 processes to apply and which to leave out
choices.B: To use a set of pre-defined templates for the size of project

questions.question_text: Which statement best explains the purpose of Tailor to suit the project environment?

discussion.content: B is the right answer. It is mentioned in 3.6 Focus on Products topic
Page 25 - 3.6

choices.A: Tailor to suit the project environment

questions.question_text: Which of the following principles uses Product Descriptions to provide clarity by defining each product's purpose, composition, derivation, format, quality criteria and quality method?

choices.B: The justification for the project should remain valid
choices.D: If the project is no longer justified it should be stopped
choices.C: The justification for the project may change
choices.A: The justification for the project must remain the same throughout the project

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements is FALSE regarding the Continued Business Justification?

discussion.content: The question is asking which statement is false. Pg 21 of the Prince2 Manual. "The Justification remains valid, and is revalidated throughout the life of the project." Further down the page, "Although the justification should remain valid, it may change." The correct answer is A, not B.

Selected Answer: A
Clearly A)
The justification for the project must remain the same throughout the project. Wrong!

Selected Answer: A
ref 3.1 of manual.
The justification of Project should remain valid and it may change. So, definitely answer should be A
A is the correct answer not B. Please revisit.
Agreed, A should be the correct answer.
Agreed, A is correct.
Option A is the correct answer according to Prince2 Manual
Should be A
A is the correct answer
A. Last paragraph of 3.1
The correct answer should be A, not B.
Arno, I fully agree! Besides A and C are completely contradicting statements. Hence, one of these two has to be true, while the other one is false. So B can never be the right answer.
